channel.title: Zombie vs Manson
channel.description:
Circumstances That Lead Me To Ask This: So i've got two scores to settle, and here it goes.... The goth department of my class is split into two homicidal divisions, one is the mason homicide unit which believe slowly killing everyone with weapons works better than explosives, then there's the zombie division which enjoys blowing shit up everywhere. What is better and/or a good substitute for either? I could care less being into reggae music myself, buttt before my school mascot decides to kill everyone on the field he'd love some advice from anyone who will listen.
Age Old Question: Rob Zombie vs Marilyn Manson. [img]http://wac.450f.edgecastcdn.net/80450F/loudwire.com/files/2012/10/Zombie_Manson.jpg[/img] Go.
FOR MANSON: Soulcist Niall jme Sk8rdude
FOR ZOMBIE: RevengePK Sk8rdude ggallin

item.title: Zombie vs Manson
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

MooningPanda:

For one, manson’s music is terribly repetitive ever since he began getting more famous, he’s terribly sold out.

When people refer to an artist as having ‘sold out’ they do it in the sense that the artist abandons their earlier music style in favour of a new style that will sell better. What you’re referring to is something along the lines of milking a cow, doing more of the same because you’ve lost any creative spark. See: The Simpsons, the Simpsons haven’t sold out they’ve been milking the show for years.

Read full topic

item.title: Zombie vs Manson
item.dc:creator: @MooningPanda MooningPanda
item.description:
@MooningPanda wrote:

[quote=“Soulcist, post:26, topic:517672”][quote author=MooningPanda link=topic=635934.msg4289912#msg4289912 date=1367047069]
i know, and it makes me want to take a gun to my mouth and pull the trigger, honest, i have clinical depression. but on a lighter note, there are still people like me stuck in the 90s, and i don’t think i want out. I’m just sad manson jumped off the bandwagon.
[/quote]
I expected him to do-so as a lot of shock rock, metal makeup wearing bands etc. (that had that sort of same image) to “shock people”… it happens.[/quote]
couldn’t be more true, it seems they’ve all changed in some way.

Read full topic

item.title: Zombie vs Manson
item.dc:creator: @MooningPanda MooningPanda
item.description:
@MooningPanda wrote:

Soulcist:

All artists change over-time, what’s new about that? It’s true that his genre that he does isn’t as popular or controversial as it was in 1990s but I don’t find him to be a sold-out.

i have to say that there is solid truth in that, but his last concert was just scene guys and girls, allot of gay and transvestites, and almost nobody dressed like they did back in the trench-coat mafia era. Nothing wrong with being scene, gay, female, or transvestite. I am just saying the fanbase changed DRASTICALLY. I dunno maybe it’s just the area the concert was in.

Read full topic

item.title: Zombie vs Manson
item.dc:creator: @MooningPanda MooningPanda
item.description:
@MooningPanda wrote:

Soulcist:

I don’t think of him as a sellout, and I still L-O-V-E him and his music, especially his new album.

first there was


then there was

so apperantly before lady gaga he was a rocker with ambition of bringing back his genre, i know he’s grown up, but tbh he’s sold out quite entirely.

It was about the music at first, now it’s all about the appearance for him. I dunno, maybe cause he’s old and can’t do the kinda drugs he used to. beats me as to why he’s changed so much.

item.title: Zombie vs Manson
item.dc:creator: @MooningPanda MooningPanda
item.description:
@MooningPanda wrote:

[quote=“Soulcist, post:18, topic:517672”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=635934.msg4287829#msg4287829 date=1366671191]
Manson is good at doing things in sick twisted ways. He allegedly sucked his own dick on stage (I have no idea if this is true). I went to one of his concerts (Thanks KBPI [A radio station in my state]) and he brought someone out on stage (his ‘wife’) and had her killed via guillotine. Though I like the beauty of murder (meaning, how it’s done and the various ways it could be done), the ways Manson would go about it aren’t… Fast enough. More would be born than he killed. Music wise, he has a very very interesting twist to his songs.
[/quote]
No… just absolutely positively no.[/quote]
now this i disagree on sk8rdude461
For one, manson’s music is terribly repetitive ever since he began getting more famous, he’s terribly sold out. I’m starting to think his song ‘this is the new shit’ was serious when he meant shit. I understand if he’s going the way Reznor is going, but honestly Reznor still has more class.

Sucking your own dick on stage just makes you look like you’re either the boss or on drugs, and it makes no statement to how cool one is. Hell at the Twins of Evil concert he was the one bitching and practically sealed his own fate with Rob Zombie, and not to mention he lost all of his original band members to zombie.

The guy is a sellout, but that doesn’t mean i don’t enjoy his old music. Dope Hat is one of the best, no matter how repetitive it is.

But whats with the creepy comment about killing everyone? Careful what you say on the internets. You'd be suprised how people can find out what school you go to.
c: my school wouldn't give a shit, especially considering im almost 20.

Read full topic

item.title: Zombie vs Manson
item.dc:creator: @MooningPanda MooningPanda
item.description:
@MooningPanda wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:16, topic:517672”][quote author=amy_webb link=topic=635934.msg4288510#msg4288510 date=1366806398]

I don’t know who Marilyn Manson is, and neither Rob Zombie. I’m not a huge fan of rock (and I think there’s around 2 guys, and maybe 1 girl, that listens to rock in my school).

Die.

I don’t think that was necessary. Honestly, just because someone doesn’t like or care for something you do, that does not mean you can go around saying ridiculous things. Personally, i don’t like either. They both seem silly, i don’t think i’d waste my time on either.
[/quote]
I can go and say any ridiculous thing I please. It’s the internet, and if he/she listened to what I said, then he’d/she’d be a moron. Honestly your comment wasn’t necessary either. So don’t be such a hypocrite

OT:

explosives while…more widely damageable leads to also longer periods of cleanup while individual torture isn’t quite as long it requires specific attention.

Too bad there isn’t a middle for gaseous death.

I don’t think the main post really retained to killing people.[/quote]
i have to say i quite agree with this

Read full topic

item.title: Zombie vs Manson
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Manson is good at doing things in sick twisted ways. He allegedly sucked his own dick on stage (I have no idea if this is true). I went to one of his concerts (Thanks KBPI [A radio station in my state]) and he brought someone out on stage (his ‘wife’) and had her killed via guillotine. Though I like the beauty of murder (meaning, how it’s done and the various ways it could be done), the ways Manson would go about it aren’t… Fast enough. More would be born than he killed. Music wise, he has a very very interesting twist to his songs.
Ex:
[youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4kQMDSw3Aqo[/youtube]

Rob Zombie on the other hand, is an amazing artist, and a man with many talents. Unlike Manson, Zombie doesn’t just play with death and music. Zombie likes special effects and directing movies. He just got done with The Lords Of Salem (which is also a song done by him), which is a horror film. You need to see the trailer to understand. He’d be great at killing loads of people. On the music side, he’s good, but his style gets old.
Ex:
(this is the song)
[youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vV0NoICl7cE[/youtube]
(this is one of the trailers)
[youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GBXumvqRAHk[/youtube]
I’m not for or against either. I like em both.

Read full topic
